result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle A. Hicks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: FINANCIAL: Letter from Bookkeeping to Defendant regarding unable to receipt check/money order

For Payment of Attorney Fees - It is hereby ordered that the Defendant is liable for court appointed attorney fees.   All attorney fees shall be paid as a condition of probation.  The judgment of conviction shall be amended to reflect said order.
The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $361.50
Petition for payment of attorney fees

Case called at 9:21 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Kyle A. Hicks in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein. ADA  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called early upon agreement of parties as is victimless case

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Gullty" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2, jeopardy attaches and further prosecution is barred

Court adopts the recommendations of the parties WITH THE exception that the Defendant may have contact with his fiance, who is known drug user.
Agreement of the parties includes:

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--AODA & Follow Through with recommended treatment, per Agent
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--Obtain/maintain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Fine and/or costs (to include agency drug testing fees - see below)
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
--Other costs

Drivers License Suspension 0 months
DNA Sample and Sucharge
Court further orders: No DNA Sample, but surcharge is applicable and costs, fees and assessments will be paid as part of probation

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 9:43 am

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle A. Hicks
Current: W9078 Lake View Drive, Cambridge, WI 53523 United States  (Effective: 11-11-2015)
Prior: W9078 Lake View Drive, Cambridge, WI 53525

Case called at 2:10pm [mo]
Defendant Kyle A. Hicks in court with Attorney Teri M. Strohschein.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct, with the exception of the zip code, which he updates
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--No contact with any known drug offenders, with the exception of his fiance Alyssa Hake
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised/DA Wambach did prosecute Mr. Hicks. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
recess: 2:16pm 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 11/18/15 at 11:40am    (2)  Status Conference on 1/26/16 at 9:30am
Order appointing counsel endorsed by Attorney Strohschein
Court appoints Attorney Teri Strohschein and orders repayment at the rate of $30 per month until the total sum is paid. The first payment shall be made on 11/30/15.
